TF030484-JAPAN CTF - FY04 GENERAL: EAP
            (ALL COUNTRIES IN EAST ASIA AND PACIFIC/A,TF052415-PHRD-INDONESIA: STRATEGIC ROADS
            INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT (SRIP)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Strategic Roads Infrastructure
            Project for Indonesia aims to improve economic
            competitiveness by reducing traffic congestion on key
            economic corridors in the borrower's islands of Java
            and Sumatra and increase the efficiency, quality and
            transparency of civil works procurement and implementation
            in the Ministry of Public Works. Land acquisition will occur
            on a varying scale for sub-projects which require widening
            of existing roads or where new roads are constructed on new
            right-of-way to manage and mitigate the risk to people and
            communities who will become affected by the land use and
            land acquisition. The resettlement plan will ensures that
            compensation is provided at market prices, that any
            entitlements to project affected persons are paid out before
            their land and other assets are taken into possession by the
            project, and that implementation of land acquisition,
            compensation and resettlement, as well as their post-
            resettlement status is monitored.
